result.execSummary:
The defendant Quentin Sherrod Gipson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment plan with case #21CT01 of $25.00/month commencing on/before the 1st of the second month after release from custody.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quentin Sherrod Gipson

records.addlTxt: Payment plan with case #21CT01 of $25.00/month commencing on/before the 1st of the second month after release from custody.

10:29 AM Defendant Quentin Sherrod Gipson appeared by phone, in custody at Dodge Correcitonal.  Attorney Mitchell Reagan LaCombe appeared by phone for Quentin Sherrod Gipson.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights on file.
950/Marsy's Law complied with. 
State's recommendation: Deft to plead to cases 21CT1 & 22CF335 - on 21CT1 $50.00 fine + costs, on 22CF335 4 months jail consecutive to Revocation sentence.
Case #21CT9 to be Dismissed and Read in.
Deft pleads No Contest to Count 1 in case #22CF335 - Court finds Deft Guilty.
Deft pleads No Contest to Count 1 in case #21CT1 - Court finds Deft Guilty.
Case #21CT09 is Dismissed and Read in.
State makes sentencing argument.
Atty LaCombe requests concurrent sentence with case #17CF251 case in which Deft was revoked. 
Deft makes statement to Court.
Court orders on 22CF335 - 4 months Jail consecutive to case #17CF251, costs to be paid on payment plan with case #21CT01.
on 21CT01- $50.00 fine +costs - payment plan with 22CF335 of $25.00/month commencing on/before the 1st of the the second month after release from custody.
Atty LaCombe requests 69 days credit. 
Court believes that credit would have applied to sentence on 17CF251 and will not order credit today.
Atty LaCombe can look into it further and request another date if he finds credit was not applied.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 10:15 am.

*NOT ON RECORD* Attorney Mitchell Reagan LaCombe appeared by phone for Quentin Sherrod Gipson.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Discovery received.  Offer received. Set for plea/sentencing hearing.
